quiz.title: Physics 11: Unit 5 Quiz 3
quiz.subtitle: Rotational Kinematics: Equations of Angular Motion
quiz.subject: Physics 11
quiz.topic: Rotational Kinematic Equations, Angular Acceleration, and Displacement

questions.question: A cooling fan slows down from 500 rpm to 200 rpm in 10.0 seconds. What is its angular acceleration?
A turntable starting from rest reaches an angular velocity of 3.49 rad/s (33.3 rpm) in 2.50 seconds. How many radians did it turn through during this acceleration?
A centrifuge rotor accelerates from rest at a constant rate of 15.0 rad/s². How long will it take to reach an angular velocity of 300 rad/s?
questions.explanation: Using ω_f = ω_i + αt: 300 = 0 + 15.0t. Solving for t gives 300 / 15.0 = 20.0 s.

questions.question: A wheel rotates through 40.0 radians in 4.00 seconds, starting from rest. What is the constant angular acceleration?
An electric drill is turned off and coasting to a stop. If it was spinning at 100 rad/s and stops after turning through 250 radians, what was its angular acceleration?
A grindstone starting from rest has a constant angular acceleration of 4.00 rad/s². What is its angular velocity after it has made 5.00 complete revolutions?
A potter's wheel slows from 12.0 rad/s to stop in 30.0 seconds. How many revolutions does it make before stopping?
questions.explanation: θ = ½(ω_i + ω_f)t = ½(12.0 + 0) × 30.0 = 180 rad. Convert to revolutions: 180 / 2π ≈ 28.6 rev.

questions.question: If a particle's angular position is given by θ = 2.0t + 0.5t², what is its angular acceleration?
questions.explanation: The equation follows the form θ = ω_i t + ½αt². Comparing the t² term, ½α = 0.5, so α = 1.0 rad/s².

questions.question: A pulley with radius 0.10 m accelerates from rest at 2.0 rad/s². What is the tangential acceleration of a point on its rim?
questions.explanation: Tangential acceleration a_t = rα = 0.10 m × 2.0 rad/s² = 0.20 m/s².

questions.question: Which of the following must be true for the rotational kinematic equations to be valid?
options: The object must be a point mass
The object must start from rest
questions.explanation: Just like linear kinematic equations (Big 5), the rotational versions are only valid if the acceleration (α) is constant.

scoreMessages.90: Brilliant! You've mastered the 'Big 5' of rotational motion.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember to always check if the question asks for radians or revolutions.
scoreMessages.50: Practice converting RPM to rad/s; this is the most common place for errors.
scoreMessages.0: Review the parallels between linear and rotational motion equations.
